title: Back Office log in data - forgotten
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS 1. I have forgotten my Client-ID/Client-CODE/Machine-code 2. I have forgotten the password for my personal user 1. I have forgotten my Client-ID/Client-CODE/Machine-code If you have forgotten your Client ID/Client-CODE/Machine-code, you can request it by e-mail: Enter your e-mail address in the following dialogue box and click on "Send request" It is important that you have registered email with DDD support as it is only the registered email that will receive the password. Of course,you can choose and register 2 or 3 emails for password recovery according to your business needs. If your email address is registered in our recipient list for the master log in, you will receive the message "Your login details has been succesfully sent to [your email address]": However, if you receive the message "Unknown email address [(your email address]), please contact Support and we will register your official email address. The good thing is it needs to be done only once and next time you are happy to use the option for forgot password. 2. I have forgotten the password for my personal user If you have forgotten the password for the user log in, it can be viewed with another Back Office User that has Master User rights. As soon as you are logged in in Back Office with a User with Master User rights, you can view the password of the corresponding User by clicking on "Maintenance"->"System users" Then click on the corresponding user and you can view the password.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1. I have forgotten my Client-ID/Client-CODE/Machine-code
  • 2. I have forgotten the password for my personal user



1. I have forgotten my Client-ID/Client-CODE/Machine-code



If you have forgotten your Client ID/Client-CODE/Machine-code, you can request it by e-mail:


Enter your e-mail address in the following dialogue box and click on "Send request"


It is important that you have registered email with DDD support as it is only the registered email that will receive the password. Of course,you can choose and register 2 or 3 emails for password recovery according to your business needs. If your email address is registered in our recipient list for the master log in, you will receive the message "Your login details has been succesfully sent to [your email address]":


However, if you receive the message "Unknown email address [(your email address]), please contact Support and we will register your official email address. The good thing is it needs to be done only once and next time you are happy to use the option for forgot password. 





2. I have forgotten the password for my personal user

 

If you have forgotten the password for the user log in, it can be viewed with another Back Office User that has Master User rights. 

 

As soon as you are logged in in Back Office with a User with Master User rights, you can view the password of the corresponding User by clicking on "Maintenance"->"System users"

 

 

Then click on the corresponding user and you can view the password.

title: Cost Price – in Backoffice
text: In DdD backoffice,the cost price for every item can be observed. It can be done by selecting the catalogue items in maintenance menau and search for a particular item that you are interested.A screenshot is shared as below. Go to maintenance Select catalogue items Enter the respective parametres click on search locate the cost price for that particular item.
description:
In DdD backoffice,the cost price for every item can be observed.
It can be done by selecting the catalogue items in maintenance menau and search for a particular item that you are interested.A screenshot is shared as below.

Go to maintenance
Select catalogue items
Enter the respective parametres
click on search
locate the cost price for that particular item.

title: Create a free of charge article
text: If you need to create an article that is free of charge, the article needs to be created with a cost price of at least 0,01. The system doesn't accept prices that are exactly 0, and will not transfer to the POS.
description:
If you need to create an article that is free of charge, the article needs to be created with a cost price of at least 0,01. 

The system doesn't accept prices that are exactly 0, and will not transfer to the POS.

title: Creation of new items in DdD Backoffice.
text: Log in to DdD Backoffice Menu Good receipt Insert Supplier Insert invoice number (Both numbers and letters can be used) Date OK Insert product group number at the bottom of the page Create Insert Article number Article Cost price Sale price Create with or without assortment Create Insert color Insert size OK Insert quantity "for draft" OK Go to "Update goods receipt" Press the small blue arrow Put a tick under "update" if you want them in stock. Tick the ones you want to "delete". Update "Are you sure you want to update the draft invoice" - press OK.
description:
• Log in to DdD Backoffice
  • Menu
  • Good receipt
  • Insert Supplier 
  • Insert invoice number (Both numbers and letters can be used) 
  • Date
  • OK



  • Insert product group number at the bottom of the page
  • Create


  • Insert Article number
  • Article
  • Cost price
  • Sale price
  • Create with or without assortment
  • Create



  • Insert color
  • Insert size
  • OK


  • Insert quantity "for draft"
  • OK



  • Go to "Update goods receipt"
  • Press the small blue arrow




  • Put a tick under "update" if you want them in stock. Tick the ones you want to "delete".
  • Update
  • "Are you sure you want to update the draft invoice" - press OK.

title: Cannot print specific price labels from Backoffice.
text: The store can notice that they are normally able to print price labels and label printer is working fine but there are some specific articles for which they are unable to print price labels. In such case,the problem is due to the special characters involved in the text description of that item. Please note that if special character like (") are involved in text description so the label printer cannot read it and thus will not be able to print labels for that specific article. An example is shared as below where there is quotation mark with the digit 13 and thus the store will not be able to print price labels for this item. Please rename the article in catalogue items with the correct text and then try to re-print the labels and it should be normally printed out by the lable printer.
description:
The store can notice that they are normally able to print price labels and label printer is working fine but there are some specific articles for which they are unable to print price labels.

In such case,the problem is due to the special characters involved in the text description of that item.

Please note that if special character like (") are involved in text description so the label printer cannot read it and thus will not be able to print labels for that specific article.

An example is shared as below where there is quotation mark with the digit 13 and thus the store will not be able to print price labels for this item.


Please rename the article in catalogue items with the correct text and then try to re-print the labels and it should be normally printed out by the lable printer.

title: Delete all files from Printout in Backoffice (delete satellitereports)
text: If there are many reports under Printout in Backoffice and you want to delete all of them, you can use this bat-file to do so. Download it to your desktop and run it. It will instruct Backoffice to remove the reports from the list.
description:
If there are many reports under Printout in Backoffice and you want to delete all of them, you can use this bat-file to do so.



Download it to your desktop and run it. It will instruct Backoffice to remove the reports from the list.

title: DdD admin does not contain any information
text: When you access DdD admin via Back Office... ...and DdD admin looks like this (does not contain any information): Then please doubleclick on the address bar of your browser: Then remove the "s" in "https" so that the link says "http://dk.dddbackoffice.com/main_home.htm". Then press on enter. The information is now available.
description:
When you access DdD admin via Back Office...


...and DdD admin looks like this (does not contain any information):



Then please doubleclick on the address bar of your browser:


Then remove the "s" in "https" so that the link says "http://dk.dddbackoffice.com/main_home.htm". Then press on enter. The information is now available.

title: Gift / credit voucher – how to delete / redeem / view
text: Gift / credit voucher – how to delete / redeem There are several ways of approaching gift / credit vouchers. If you need to delete one, you will have to redeem it (see Solution 4) If you want an overview, this can be done both through the POS (see Solution 5) and Backoffice (see Solution 1-3). If you want to redeem / delete a gift / credit voucher, you can only do this through Backoffice (see Solution 4). Solution 1 – Lookup a voucher If you have the gift / credit voucher number and/or date it was created and you want to see whether it has been redeemed, do this: Step 1: Log into Backoffice Step 2: (1) Gift / credit vouchers (2) Screen lookup Step 3: Add (1) the create date and/or the (2) gift / credit voucher number and click (3) Search Step 4: You will now have an overview of which gift / credit vouchers have been created on that date and which of them have been redeemed already. (This is only an overview. You cannot change anything in this view). Solution 2 – Print a list of all redeemed vouchers Step 1: Click on (2) Print Unredeemed Step 2: (1) Add from/to date (2) Choose if you want to see a list of gift vouchers / credit vouchers or both (3) Tick if you want to see all lines (4) Tick which shop you want them from (if there are more than one) (5) Click order The list will appear under Printout Solution 3 – Print a list of all vouchers This list shows all gift / credit vouchers by number, when they were created and when they were redeemed. Step 1: Click on Print transactions Step 2: (1) Add from/to date (2) choose if you want to see a list of gift vouchers / credit vouchers or both (3) Tick which shop you want them from (if there are more than one) (4) Click Order The list will appear under Printout Solution 4 – Redeem / delete voucher This list shows open gift / credit vouchers. It does not show already redeemed vouchers. Step 1: Click Maintenance Step 2: (1) Enter a date after the creation date (if you don’t know the exact date, just choose an approximate date, but always after the creation date) (2) Click search Step 3: The newest date will be at the bottom of the list, so scroll down if necessary. Step 4: Once you have located the voucher, (1) tick the box next to the redemption date and (2) click Redeem. The voucher has now been redeemed/deleted and can no longer be used on the POS. Solution 5 – Print lists from the POS Step 1: Click on (1) Shortcuts Click on (2) Reports Step 2: Choose which list you wish to see/print. To only view the list, remember to tick Print Journal to screen. (1) Fill in the dates (2) Gift voucher log (all gift vouchers) (3) Creditnote log (all credit vouchers) (4) Open Gift Vouchers (5) Open Creditnotes (6) Tik this if you do not want to print the list, but merely see it on your screen.
description:
Gift / credit voucher – how to delete / redeem

 

There are several ways of approaching gift / credit vouchers.


If you need to delete one, you will have to redeem it (see Solution 4)


If you want an overview, this can be done both through the POS (see Solution 5) and Backoffice (see Solution 1-3).


If you want to redeem / delete a gift / credit voucher, you can only do this through Backoffice (see Solution 4).

 

Solution 1 – Lookup a voucher


If you have the gift / credit voucher number and/or date it was created and you want to see whether it has been redeemed, do this:

 

Step 1: Log into Backoffice

 

Step 2: 


(1) Gift / credit vouchers


(2) Screen lookup 


 

Step 3: Add (1) the create date and/or the (2) gift / credit voucher number and click (3) Search

 

 

Step 4: You will now have an overview of which gift / credit vouchers have been created on that date and which of them have been redeemed already.


(This is only an overview. You cannot change anything in this view).


 

Solution 2 – Print a list of all redeemed vouchers

 

Step 1: Click on (2) Print Unredeemed

 

 

Step 2: 


(1) Add from/to date


(2) Choose if you want to see a list of gift vouchers / credit vouchers or both


(3) Tick if you want to see all lines


(4) Tick which shop you want them from (if there are more than one)


(5) Click order

 

 

The list will appear under Printout



 

Solution 3 – Print a list of all vouchers


This list shows all gift / credit vouchers by number, when they were created and when they were redeemed.


Step 1: Click on Print transactions



Step 2: 


(1) Add from/to date


(2) choose if you want to see a list of gift vouchers / credit vouchers or both


(3) Tick which shop you want them from (if there are more than one)


(4) Click Order

 


The list will appear under Printout



 

Solution 4 – Redeem / delete voucher


This list shows open gift / credit vouchers. It does not show already redeemed vouchers.


Step 1: Click Maintenance



Step 2: 


(1) Enter a date after the creation date (if you don’t know the exact date, just choose an approximate date, but always after the creation date)


(2) Click search



Step 3: The newest date will be at the bottom of the list, so scroll down if necessary.


Step 4: Once you have located the voucher, (1) tick the box next to the redemption date and (2) click Redeem.

 


The voucher has now been redeemed/deleted and can no longer be used on the POS.

 

Solution 5 – Print lists from the POS


Step 1: 


Click on (1) Shortcuts


Click on (2) Reports


 

Step 2: Choose which list you wish to see/print. To only view the list, remember to tick Print Journal to screen.


(1) Fill in the dates


(2) Gift voucher log (all gift vouchers)


(3) Creditnote log (all credit vouchers)


(4) Open Gift Vouchers


(5) Open Creditnotes


(6) Tik this if you do not want to print the list, but merely see it on your screen.

title: How can you create payment methods?
text: To create payment methods for the cash register, go to System -> Parameters -> Payment methods in Cowi's back office As is usual in the Cowis.Net back office, you can create a new payment method with F5 or New Meaning of the individual fields: Name: Name of the payment method displayed at the checkout (max. 10 characters) Sorting: Where in the payment method list at the checkout the payment method appears Display: whether the payment method should even be displayed at the checkout Sales: defines whether the payment method at the checkout generates sales or not Bank: Whether the payment method can be used for bank deposits, usually only cash, i.e. euros or possible foreign currencies such as CHF (Swiss francs) Account number: If another account should be addressed instead of the general account in the transfer to financial accounting (usually not used) Telecash: Whether the payment method should be transferred to a PT (pay terminal) connected to the checkout Withdrawal: Whether payment should be possible using this payment method in the event of an exchange. Usually cash and voucher, sometimes handover to a PT
description:
To create payment methods for the cash register, go to System -> Parameters -> Payment methods in Cowi's back office


As is usual in the Cowis.Net back office, you can create a new payment method with F5 or New

Meaning of the individual fields:

Name: Name of the payment method displayed at the checkout (max. 10 characters)

Sorting: Where in the payment method list at the checkout the payment method appears

Display: whether the payment method should even be displayed at the checkout

Sales: defines whether the payment method at the checkout generates sales or not

Bank: Whether the payment method can be used for bank deposits, usually only cash, i.e. euros or possible foreign currencies such as CHF (Swiss francs)

Account number: If another account should be addressed instead of the general account in the transfer to financial accounting (usually not used)

Telecash: Whether the payment method should be transferred to a PT (pay terminal) connected to the checkout

Withdrawal: Whether payment should be possible using this payment method in the event of an exchange. Usually cash and voucher, sometimes handover to a PT

title: How to add a new Back Office User
text: If you want to add a new user to Back Office, this can be done in Back Office by a User with Master rights. (If you do not know, which User has Master rights, you can contact Support.) 1. Log in to Back Office and click on "Maintenance"->"System users" 2. Click on "Create System User" 3. Fill out User number (choose the number already entered or a number between 1 and 99), User name and Password 4. Tick the box "Master" if you want the user to have master rights 5. Do not tick the Box "Negative receipt of goods is not allowed" 6. It is not necessary to fill in an email address 7. Tick the box "Access to DdD Admin" if you want the user to have access to DdD Admin 8. At "Create new user with same rights as user", choose a user that has the rights you want the new user to have. You can click on the users on the table to the left to see which rights they have. 9. If the user has a shop assistant number in the POS, enter the number in the field "Clerk no." 10. Click "Create"
description:
If you want to add a new user to Back Office, this can be done in Back Office by a User with Master rights. (If you do not know, which User has Master rights, you can contact Support.)


1. Log in to Back Office and click on "Maintenance"->"System users"


2. Click on "Create System User"



3. Fill out User number (choose the number already entered or a number between 1 and 99), User name and Password


4. Tick the box "Master" if you want the user to have master rights


5. Do not tick the Box "Negative receipt of goods is not allowed"

6. It is not necessary to fill in an email address


7. Tick the box "Access to DdD Admin" if you want the user to have access to DdD Admin


8. At "Create new user with same rights as user", choose a user that has the rights you want the new user to have. You can click on the users on the table to the left to see which rights they have.

9. If the user has a shop assistant number in the POS, enter the number in the field "Clerk no."


10. Click "Create"

title: How to clear list of ordered old prints queue in Backoffice
text: When a system user login to backoffice and they order a specific report,sometimes there is a long queue of old prints standing in the printout menu which makes it difficult and time consuming for the user to track its own report. An example is shown as below. It should be noted that the queue can be reset and it gives easy access and is user friendly.All these reports are stored in a specific folder on C drive and one can delete all the old reports from that folder. The path for the folder is shared as below. Go to C: drive Select Saclient Then select download Select all files in download folder by pressing CTRL+A and press delete. After deleting all files from the download folder as shown below will reset the queue list to null in backoffice. You will also notice that the green plus sign is vanished from the prinouts menu
description:
When a system user login to backoffice and they order a specific report,sometimes there is a long queue of old prints standing in the printout menu which makes it difficult and time consuming for the user to track its own report.

An example is shown as below.



It should be noted that the queue can be reset and it gives easy access and is user friendly.All these reports are stored in a specific folder on C drive and one can delete all the old reports from that folder.

The path for the folder is shared as below.

Go to C: drive
Select Saclient
Then select download
Select all files in download folder by pressing CTRL+A and press delete.
After deleting all files from the download folder as shown below will reset the queue list to null in backoffice.
You will also notice that the green plus sign is vanished from the prinouts menu

title: How to delete a Receipt of Goods
text: To delete a Receipt of Goods, you have to click on the blue arrow in the Receipt of Goods line, tick the "Delete" box and press on "Confirm"
description: To delete a Receipt of Goods, you have to click on the blue arrow in the Receipt of Goods line, tick the "Delete" box and press on "Confirm"

title: How to edit a BackOffice user
text: If you want to edit a user in Back Office, this can be done in Back Office by a User with Master rights. (If you do not know, which User has Master rights, you can contact Support.) 1. Log in to Back Office and click on "Maintenance"->"System users" 2. Click on the user you want to edit 3. Change the information as needed 4. Tick the box "Master" if you want the user to have master rights 5. Do not tick the Box "Negative receipt of goods is not allowed" 6. It is not necessary to fill in an email address 7. Tick the box "Access to DdD Admin" if you want the user to have access to DdD Admin 10. Click "OK"
description:
If you want to edit a user in Back Office, this can be done in Back Office by a User with Master rights. (If you do not know, which User has Master rights, you can contact Support.)


1. Log in to Back Office and click on "Maintenance"->"System users"


2. Click on the user you want to edit



3. Change the information as needed


4. Tick the box "Master" if you want the user to have master rights


5. Do not tick the Box "Negative receipt of goods is not allowed"

6. It is not necessary to fill in an email address


7. Tick the box "Access to DdD Admin" if you want the user to have access to DdD Admin


10. Click "OK"

title: Inquiry about a specific giftcard-history
text: Sometime,the store needs more information regarding the history of a specific giftcard. The store needs to trace the receipts from the pos on which date and time that specific giftcard was utilized. It can be done in backoffice by selecting the menu Gavekort/Tilgodesedler(giftcards/credit notes) then select Opslag, enter the requested giftcard number (24 digits) and then press search. After clicking on the search button,a window will appear showing the history of that particular giftcard explaining which date and time it was used and by whom. An Example is shown as below when the requested giftcard number was entered,the following window with all information appeared. This information(date and time) can be used to trace a specific receipt number regarding that giftcard.
description:
Sometime,the store needs more information regarding the history of a specific giftcard.
The store needs to trace the receipts from the pos on which date and time that specific giftcard was utilized.

It can be done in backoffice by selecting the menu Gavekort/Tilgodesedler(giftcards/credit notes)
then select Opslag, enter the requested giftcard number (24 digits) and then press search.




After clicking on the search button,a window will appear showing the history of that particular giftcard explaining which date and time it was used and by whom.

An Example is shown as below when the requested giftcard number was entered,the following window with all information appeared.
This information(date and time) can be used to trace a specific receipt number regarding that giftcard.

title: Issue with printing from backoffice / Installing SaClient
text: If you are getting the message that SaClient is missing/not installed ... .. and you get exclamation marks on these 3 buttons ... that means SaClient is either missing, broken or needs an update. The solution to that problem is installing/reinstalling the SaClient. This guide will show you how to do that. 1. Press the yellow "Ok" button. 2. SaClient will download. Right-click on the file and choose Show In Folder 3. Right-click on the SaClientInstaller and choose Run as administrator. 4. You may get the below window. Click on More Info 5. Click on Run Anyway 6. Wait for the SaClient to be installed. 7. The exclamation marks will disappear. If they do not, refresh the window by clicking the round arrow. 8. If the exclamation marks still do not disappear, download FixSaClient.bat (download attachment at the bottom of this page). 9. If you get this message when trying to download it, click the three dots and click Keep to allow Chrome to save the file. 10. In the next window, click Show more and then Keep anyway 11. Click Show in Folder. If you do not get this window (or something similar), click on the three dots in the top right corner of Chrome and choose Downloads, locate the FixSaClient.bat and click on Show in Folder 12. Right-click on the file and choose Run as Administrator 13. Press Y on your keyboard to run the program. 14. Return to Google Chrome (shut down or minimize any extra windows). 15. Clear the cache in Google Chrome by clicking on the three dots, More tools and Clear browsing data. 16. Make sure that only the 4 shown options are ticked. DO NOT delete Passwords and other sign-in data. 17. Click clear data. 18. Log out of Backoffice and shut down Google Chrome 19. Turn off the printer for 10 seconds, then turn it back on and log into Backoffice again. Now it should work. If it still does not work, then create a ticket and we will take a look at it as fast as possible.
description:
If you are getting the message that SaClient is missing/not installed ...



.. and you get exclamation marks on these 3 buttons


... that means SaClient is either missing, broken or needs an update. The solution to that problem is installing/reinstalling the SaClient. 


This guide will show you how to do that. 


1. Press the yellow "Ok" button. 


 

2. SaClient will download. Right-click on the file and choose Show In Folder




3. Right-click on the SaClientInstaller and choose Run as administrator.


4. You may get the below window. Click on More Info



5. Click on Run Anyway


6. Wait for the SaClient to be installed.



7. The exclamation marks will disappear. If they do not, refresh the window by clicking the round arrow.



8. If the exclamation marks still do not disappear, download FixSaClient.bat (download attachment at the bottom of this page).


9. If you get this message when trying to download it, click the three dots and click Keep to allow Chrome to save the file.



10. In the next window, click Show more and then Keep anyway



11. Click Show in Folder. 

If you do not get this window (or something similar), click on the three dots in the top right corner of Chrome and choose Downloads, locate the FixSaClient.bat and click on Show in Folder



12. Right-click on the file and choose Run as Administrator



13. Press Y on your keyboard to run the program.



14. Return to Google Chrome (shut down or minimize any extra windows).


15. Clear the cache in Google Chrome by clicking on the three dots, More tools and Clear browsing data.



16. Make sure that only the 4 shown options are ticked. DO NOT delete Passwords and other sign-in data.


17. Click clear data.



18. Log out of Backoffice and shut down Google Chrome



19. Turn off the printer for 10 seconds, then turn it back on and log into Backoffice again.


Now it should work.


If it still does not work, then create a ticket and we will take a look at it as fast as possible.

title: Labels information adjustment in Backoffice
text: When a clerk prints a label from a label printer, It can happen that labels informaton is shifted. It means that the text and barcode printed on the labels are either moved horizentally or in vertical direction. IT is possible to adjust the settings in Backoffice and can try different offsets and choose the right settings that should work for a label.The default offset should be between 0 and 90.The correct offset needs to be find out by trying changing values for offset lodret and offset vandret. I am sharing two examples below where it can be observed in the first one that the information is on the topmost end of the label.It means we have to change vertical values (offset lodret) that can move the label a little down. In this case,the offset lodret value was changed from 60 to 40 and the print out should be on perfect location. In the Second example it can be observed that the label needs be adjusted vertically up and we should increase the value in offset lodret.In case we have a value 20 so we should change it to 40 and check again how it looks. The procedure to change the values in Backoffice is as: Login to Backoffice select Program Menu Select Maintenance Select LabelOpsætning In the screenshot above,Alm.Stregkode is used to change the information on the barcode etc. Udsalgsprismærker is selected if information needs to be updated only on the sales labels. After saving the changes/new offset values, A reload must be executed in ekspedient bar on POS in order to update it on the POS. Repeat the procedure if the text/information needs to be adjusted more on the label.
description:
When a clerk prints a label from a label printer, It can happen that labels informaton is shifted.
It means that the text and barcode printed on the labels are either moved horizentally or in vertical direction.



IT  is possible to adjust the settings in Backoffice and can try different offsets and choose the right settings that should work for a label.The default offset should be between 0 and 90.The correct offset needs to be find out by trying changing values for offset lodret and offset vandret.


I am sharing two examples below where it can be observed in the first one that the information is on the topmost end of the label.It means we have to change vertical values (offset lodret) that can move the label a little down.
In this case,the offset lodret value was changed from 60 to 40 and the print out should be on perfect location.


In the Second example it can be observed that the label needs be adjusted vertically up and we should increase the value in offset lodret.In case we have a value 20 so we should change it to 40 and check again how it looks.





The procedure to change the values in Backoffice is as:


Login to Backoffice
select Program Menu
Select Maintenance

Select LabelOpsætning




In the screenshot above,Alm.Stregkode is used to change the information on the barcode etc.
Udsalgsprismærker is selected if information needs to be updated only on the sales labels.

After saving the changes/new offset values, A reload must be executed in ekspedient bar on POS in order to update it on the POS. Repeat the procedure if the text/information needs to be adjusted more on the label.

title: List of gift vouchers
Location of backoffice printouts on your PC
text: Your printouts are visible in Backoffice, however you can also access them in a folder located on the pc the printout has been made. To find these printouts, you must go to the folder in this path: Note that "OS" is where the name of your own device/user would be. You will find all previous printouts from backoffice in the download folder at the end of this path
description:
Your printouts are visible in Backoffice, however you can also access them in a folder located on the pc the printout has been made. 


To find these printouts, you must go to the folder in this path: 

Note that "OS" is where the name of your own device/user would be. 


You will find all previous printouts from backoffice in the download folder at the end of this path

title: Log in to Back Office - OK button does not work
text: If you klick on the "OK" button when logging in to Back Office and nothing happens, please try to press "Enter" on you keyboard instead. If that does not help, please create a ticket or send an email to support@k3btg.com.
description:
If you klick on the "OK" button when logging in to Back Office and nothing happens, please try to press "Enter" on you keyboard instead.

If that does not help, please create a ticket or send an email to support@k3btg.com.

title: Need to redeem/delete a gift voucher
text: In order to delete a gift voucher, you have to redeem it. If you want to redeem a gift card, the procedure is as follows: Go to the Back office and select Giftcards/returnnotes in the Program menu Then select the icon Vedligehold/Maintenance and enter the required date (you can choose the current date). Locate the required gift card number. You can also use CTRL+F and enter the required number of the gift card. In this case, I am redeeming the giftcard with the number 198100124072301066005000. Check the tick button and select the option Indløs/Redeem. The card has now been redeemed and you can also check the status of the particular gift card. To do this, select Opslag/Bulletin in the same menu, enter the gift card number as displayed, click on the search option, and you will be able to view the updated status of the gift card. We can now confirm that the gift card status has been updated to "redeemed/indløst" and is no longer in the system.
description:
In order to delete a gift voucher, you have to redeem it.
If you want to redeem a gift card, the procedure is as follows:
Go to the Back office and select Giftcards/returnnotes in the Program menu
Then select the icon Vedligehold/Maintenance and enter the required date (you can choose the current date).



Locate the required gift card number. You can also use CTRL+F and enter the required number of the gift card.
In this case, I am redeeming the giftcard with the number 198100124072301066005000.
Check the tick button and select the option Indløs/Redeem.




The card has now been redeemed and you can also check the status of the particular gift card. To do this, select Opslag/Bulletin in the same menu, enter the gift card number as displayed, click on the search option, and you will be able to view the updated status of the gift card.


We can now confirm that the gift card status has been updated to "redeemed/indløst" and is no longer in the system.

title: New Master Logon / change Machine in Back Office
text: If you want to change the Machine in Back Office, you have to log in with a new Master Logon. Maintenance -> New Master Logon -> OK Afterwards you can log in again with your Client-ID and Client-CODE and then choose another machine. If you do not remember your Client-ID or Client-CODE, follow this guide to get the log in data: I have forgotten my Back Office log in data
description:
If you want to change the Machine in Back Office, you have to log in with a new Master Logon.

Maintenance -> New Master Logon -> OK


Afterwards you can log in again with your Client-ID and Client-CODE and then choose another machine. If you do not remember your Client-ID or Client-CODE, follow this guide to get the log in data: I have forgotten my Back Office log in data

title: Receipt: change text
text: 1. Log into the POS and click on the Screen with wrench button. 2. Choose Store and POS and click on "Change this machine only" 3. Choose "Header text" or "Footer text" 4. Make the changes in the text and click on "Save" 5. Log out of the POS, Click Cancel Sale and type “reload” in the Shop assistant field and click the green button.
description:
1. 1. Log into the POS and click on the Screen with wrench button. 

  

 

  

  1. 2. Choose Store and POS and click on "Change this machine only" 

    3. Choose "Header text" or "Footer text"

    4. Make the changes in the text and click on "Save"


  1. 5. Log out of the POS, Click Cancel Sale and type “reload” in the Shop assistant field and click the green button.

title: Reports regrading ''Diverse'' itemgroup from backoffice
text: There are different types of reports that can be ordered in backoffice under menu Udskrifter. The most common report that the stores needs are related to Stock statistics as shown in the screenshot(pic 1) below. The corresponding report can be ordered in backoffice and reports are generated in pdf with all the required information. Pic 1: But when a report is needed on the basis of special itemgroups ''Diverse'' etc (shown in pic 2) so it must be noted that the supplier 0 is selected as all special itemgroups are related to supplier manual sale otherwise you will get an empty report as shown in pic3. pic 2: Pic 3: The supplier 0 must be selected in order to generate a report on the basis of special itemgroups.
description:
There are different types of reports that can be ordered in backoffice under menu Udskrifter.
The most common report that the stores needs are related to Stock statistics as shown in the screenshot(pic 1) below.


The corresponding report can be ordered in backoffice and reports are generated in pdf with all the required information.

Pic 1:



But when a report is needed on the basis of special itemgroups ''Diverse'' etc (shown in pic 2) so it must be noted that the supplier 0 is selected as all special itemgroups are related to supplier manual sale otherwise you will get an empty report as shown in pic3.

pic 2:

Pic 3:


The supplier 0 must be selected in order to generate a report on the basis of special itemgroups.

title: Reprint Pricetags
text: In case you need to reprint a pricetag. Go to DDD backoffice. Choose Stock -> Reprint Lables Choose date and supplier and click Search Click on the label next to the item you want to reprint labels for (and how many).
description:
In case you need to reprint a pricetag. Go to DDD backoffice. 


Choose Stock -> Reprint Lables  

 Choose date and supplier and click Search  


Click on the label next to the item you want to reprint labels for (and how many).

title: Summary reports
text: Summary report on suppliers/productlines, which can also be divided into catalogue items and variants. Summary report sup/prodl. only gives an overview of how many items have been sold from the supplier and divided into productlines. PDF Example: Summary report sup/prodl. divided by catalogue items shows a list of suppliers and productlines divided by catalogue items sold/in stock. PDF Example: Summary report sup/prodl. divided into catalogue items and variants shows everything (very big list). PDF Example:
description:
Summary report on suppliers/productlines, which can also be divided into catalogue items and variants.

 

  1. Summary report sup/prodl.  only gives an overview of how many items have been sold from the supplier and divided into productlines.

    PDF Example:



     
  2. Summary report sup/prodl. divided by catalogue items shows a list of suppliers and productlines divided by catalogue items sold/in stock.

    PDF Example:

     
  3. Summary report sup/prodl. divided into catalogue items and variants shows everything (very big list).

    PDF Example:

title: Suppliers - add to Backoffice
text: To add a new supplier, follow the below steps. 1. Log into Backoffice 2. Choose Maintenance 3. Choose Suppliers 4. Click Create Supplier 5. Fill in at the very least Supplier No. and Name 6. Set Currency if it is different from what is already listed 7. Choose Calculation factor Calculation factor = (Sales price / Purchase price) * 100 If an item has a purchase price of $100 and you want to sell it for $150, then the costing factor is: 150 Calculation factor = (150 kr. / 100 kr.) * 100 = 150 So a calculation factor of, for example, 300 means that if an item costs $100 to purchase, the sales price the system calculates is $300, or in other words, the sales price is 3 times the purchase price. 8. Click Create
description:
To add a new supplier, follow the below steps.


1. Log into Backoffice


2. Choose Maintenance 


3. Choose Suppliers


4. Click Create Supplier


5. Fill in at the very least Supplier No. and Name


6. Set Currency if it is different from what is already listed


7. Choose Calculation factor


Calculation factor = (Sales price / Purchase price) * 100


If an item has a purchase price of $100 and you want to sell it for $150, then the costing factor is: 150

Calculation factor = (150 kr. / 100 kr.) * 100 = 150


So a calculation factor of, for example, 300 means that if an item costs $100 to purchase, the sales price the system calculates is $300, or in other words, the sales price is 3 times the purchase price.


8. Click Create

title: Variant history-Backoffice
text: During the working day at a store one can have different questions regarding an item like when was it sold last time or when was it purchased and what was the cost price for that item and how many are in stock. Variant history is an important feature in backoffice when it is necessary get different information about a specific item. The information can be observed in the below screenshots. Go to Program menu Select Storage Select varianthistory/varianthistorian Choose respective dates and enter more information about a product for example item number,season etc. The new window will show all the details about the item when it was purchased and when was it sold last time during a particular interval.
description:
During the working day at a store one can have different questions regarding an item like when was it sold last time or when was it purchased and what was the cost price for that item and how many are in stock.

Variant history is an important feature in backoffice when it is necessary get different information about a specific item.
The information can be observed in the below screenshots.

Go to Program menu
Select Storage
Select varianthistory/varianthistorian
Choose respective dates and enter more information about a product for example
item number,season etc.

The new window will show all the details about the item when it was purchased and when was it sold last time during a particular interval.

title: Wrong shop assistant names in Back Office or DdD Reports
text: If you've changed the name of a shop assistant, the update will be visible in the POS but not in Back Office or DdD Reports. Therefore, when changing the name that is linked to a existing shop assistant number, always begin by deleting the existing shop assistant, and then add the new assistant: Example: You want to change the name of the shop assistant with number 1. Currently, the shop assistant with number one is named 'Bob,' and we wish to change it to 'Susanne'. To do this, start by navigating to DdD Admin Then, choose Store and POS. Then, choose Shop assistants and delete the User. Don't forget to klick "save" at the end of the page (you might have to scroll down)! Now that the shop assistant with the number 1 has been deleted, you can create a new shop assistant with the number 1, in our example with the name "Susanne". For doing that, follow the instructions given in our solution article Shop assistant - add new
description:
If you've changed the name of a shop assistant, the update will be visible in the POS but not in Back Office or DdD Reports.


Therefore, when changing the name that is linked to a existing shop assistant number, always begin by deleting the existing shop assistant, and then add the new assistant:


Example:

You want to change the name of the shop assistant with number 1. Currently, the shop assistant with number one is named 'Bob,' and we wish to change it to 'Susanne'.


To do this, start by navigating to DdD Admin




Then, choose Store and POS.

Then, choose Shop assistants and delete the User.


Don't forget to klick "save" at the end of the page (you might have to scroll down)!


Now that the shop assistant with the number 1 has been deleted, you can create a new shop assistant with the number 1, in our example with the name "Susanne". For doing that, follow the instructions given in our solution article Shop assistant - add new

title: Change the price of an item in Backoffice
text: Depending on which price grouping you belong to, there are two ways of changing the prices of items in Backoffice. MVK: 1. Choose Receipt of goods 2. Extract one item from every variant you wish to change the price for 3. Enter -1 in To draft 4. update receipt of goods 5. Create another receipt of goods 6. Enter 1 in To draft and repeat for each of the items you have extracted one from previously 7. Calculate the price for each item 8. Add new cost price if necessary 9. Add new sales price if necessary 10. Add a tick if this should go for all variants (colors, sizes etc.) 11. Click Ok to accept 12. Update Receipt of goods again. Then try to run a reload / restart on the POS. If this does not work, run a changepull. This should update the prices on the POS. If you experience any issues, please contact support. VKM - KVM: 1. Catalogue Items and find the item you want to change the price for. 2. Change Cost Price if necessary 3. Change Sales Price if necessary 4. Click OK
description:
Depending on which price grouping you belong to, there are two ways of changing the prices of items in Backoffice.



MVK:


1. Choose Receipt of goods


2. Extract one item from every variant you wish to change the price for


3. Enter -1 in To draft


4. update receipt of goods


 


5. Create another receipt of goods


6. Enter 1 in To draft and repeat for each of the items you have extracted one from previously


7. Calculate the price for each item



8. Add new cost price if necessary


9. Add new sales price if necessary


10. Add a tick if this should go for all variants (colors, sizes etc.)


11. Click Ok to accept 



12. Update Receipt of goods again.


Then try to run a reload / restart on the POS. If this does not work, run a changepull. This should update the prices on the POS.


If you experience any issues, please contact support.




VKM - KVM:


1. Catalogue Items and find the item you want to change the price for.


2. Change Cost Price if necessary


3. Change Sales Price if necessary


4. Click OK

title: List of returned items / goods placed in stock
text: If you accidentally close a bookkeeping receipt, or you just want a list of what has been returned or placed in stock for one specific day, you can do as follows: Log into your backoffice. 1. Open Reports and statistics 2. Choose Transactions 3. Enter start date 4. Enter end date 5. Choose Purchase of goods 6. Click Order You will receive a list of the day's returns / stock additions under Printouts.
description:
If you accidentally close a bookkeeping receipt, or you just want a list of what has been returned or placed in stock for one specific day, you can do as follows:



Log into your backoffice.


1. Open Reports and statistics


2. Choose Transactions


3. Enter start date


4. Enter end date


5. Choose Purchase of goods


6. Click Order


You will receive a list of the day's returns / stock additions under Printouts.

title: Financereport
text: This report gives you a total overview of what happened yesterday on the POS. Login to DDDbackoffice Choose menu -> Reports and statistics -> Financial Reports Choose the period (for specific date, chose same date in both fields) Group by POS - set a mark here if you have more than 1 POS and want a separate report pr. POS. Stock(shop) - choose what store you want the report from
description:
This report gives you a total overview of what happened yesterday on the POS.

Login to DDDbackoffice
Choose menu -> Reports and statistics -> Financial Reports

Choose the period (for specific date, chose same date in both fields)
Group by POS - set a mark here if you have more than 1 POS and want a separate report pr. POS.
Stock(shop) - choose what store you want the report from

title: Query about receiving goods in Backoffice.
text: Sometime,the stores contact the support team that they have received new items in backoffice but due to some reasons they were not able to follow up and are not sure if the items are registered in backoffice or not. In such case,there is a possiblility to order an invoice report by checking the option with Update Status(5). This report shows information about all invoices being received on a particcular date and whether it has been updated in the system or not. An example is shown below. The report generated will show all information regarding the supplier,item group,invoice information and its update status. As shown below,it also shows which system user in backoffice has actually updated the items. In this case,the backoffice user 1 with name Assistance has updated the invoice 253451 on 03/04/2024. It also helps to track who in the store has updated a particular item/invoice and on which date.
description:
Sometime,the stores contact the support team that they have received new items in backoffice but due to some reasons they were not able to follow up and are not sure if the items are registered in backoffice or not.

In such case,there is a possiblility to order an invoice report by checking the option with Update Status(5).

This report shows information about all invoices being received on a particcular date and whether it has been updated in the system or not.

An example is shown below.


The report generated will show all information regarding the supplier,item group,invoice information and its update status.
As shown below,it also shows which system user in backoffice has actually updated the items.
In this case,the backoffice user 1 with name Assistance has updated the invoice 253451 on 03/04/2024.
It also helps to track who in the store has updated a particular item/invoice and on which date.

title: Location of printed lists from POS (RIAB)
text: If youre unable to find a printed list in DDD POS, it can possibly be found saved in a folder in windows. Follow the path shown in the below image, and you will find your printouts
description:
If youre unable to find a printed list in DDD POS, it can possibly be found saved in a folder in windows.


Follow the path shown in the below image, and you will find your printouts

title: Hvornår en vare bliver registreret som værende "i lager
text: Varerne ankommer til lageret, når du godkender/ajourføre dette i varemodtagelsen, men i variantens historik viser datoen kun, hvornår varerne først blev registreret/lagt i systemet.
description: Varerne ankommer til lageret, når du godkender/ajourføre dette i varemodtagelsen, men i variantens historik viser datoen kun, hvornår varerne først blev registreret/lagt i systemet.

title: when an item is registered as being "in stock-Backoffice
text: The goods arrive at a warehouse when you approve this in the goods receipt in backoffice, but in the variant's history the visible date only shows when the goods were first registered/put in the system.
description: The goods arrive at a warehouse when you approve this in the goods receipt in backoffice, but in the variant's history the visible date only shows when the goods were first registered/put in the system.

title: How to see the date of last status/ajourføring
text: You can check the date in backoffice in "start status". There will be a line showing the date of the previous status
description:
You can check the date in backoffice in "start status". 


There will be a line showing the date of the previous status

title: Delete an item transfer before it has been updated
text: Open Update item transfer in the menu Stock, choose "From this stock" and klick on the blue arrow in the line of the item transfer you want to delete: Tick the box underneath "Delete" and press "Confirm" The item transfer has now been deleted.
description:
Open Update item transfer in the menu Stock, choose "From this stock" and klick on the blue arrow in the line of the item transfer you want to delete:



Tick the box underneath "Delete" and press "Confirm"



The item transfer has now been deleted.

title: Create new product line
text: Log into Backoffice 1. Choose Maintenance 2. Choose Product lines 3. Choose Create department Fill in (1) Number, (2) Description, (3) POS text, (4) whether it needs VAT or not, (5) tick if you need an EAN number. 4. Click Create Remember to run reload or restart on the POS to update it. It can take some time before it is visible on the POS.
description:
Log into Backoffice


1. Choose Maintenance


2. Choose Product lines


3. Choose Create department


Fill in (1) Number, (2) Description, (3) POS text, (4) whether it needs VAT or not, (5) tick if you need an EAN number.


4. Click Create


Remember to run reload or restart on the POS to update it. It can take some time before it is visible on the POS.

title: Withdraw an item from stock
text: 1. To withdraw items from stock, you need to create a receipt of goods in Backoffice. 2.-4. Locate item 1.-2. Add the number of items you want to withdraw with a minus in front You can get an overview of what you are registering in the Invoice/delivery note. Update receipt of goods. The items have now been withdrawn from stock.
description:
1. To withdraw items from stock, you need to create a receipt of goods in Backoffice.


2.-4. Locate item


1.-2. Add the number of items you want to withdraw with a minus in front



You can get an overview of what you are registering in the Invoice/delivery note.



Update receipt of goods. The items have now been withdrawn from stock.

title: Delete newly created catalogue items
text: If you have created a catalogue item and realize you made a mistake, you can delete the whole thing and start over - providing you have not yet put any items in stock for this catalogue item. Open Catalogue Items Locate the supplier and/or catalogue parameters First choose Item if you have already added items to the catalogue item. Tick the delete field on every single item and click OK at the bottom. Click Back and choose Cat. (see first image) Choose Delete to remove the catalogue item. Now you can start over.
description:
If you have created a catalogue item and realize you made a mistake, you can delete the whole thing and start over - providing you have not yet put any items in stock for this catalogue item.


Open Catalogue Items


Locate the supplier and/or catalogue parameters


First choose Item if you have already added items to the catalogue item.



Tick the delete field on every single item and click OK at the bottom.



Click Back and choose Cat. (see first image)



Choose Delete to remove the catalogue item.


Now you can start over.

title: Supplier currency
text: The correct currency has to be added when creating a new supplier, it is not possible to change the currency retroactive.
description: The correct currency has to be added when creating a new supplier, it is not possible to change the currency retroactive.

title: How do I log out of Backoffice completely?
text: If you have accidentally logged into a wrong machine ID or used a wrong Client ID, you can log out of Backoffice completely by doing this: 1. Click on Maintenance 2. Click on New Master Logon
description:
If you have accidentally logged into a wrong machine ID or used a wrong Client ID, you can log out of Backoffice completely by doing this:


1. Click on Maintenance

2. Click on New Master Logon

title: Exclamation marks in Backoffice / Can't retrieve reports and/or print labels
text: If you have yellow (or red) exclamation marks in Backoffice on Label, Printout and SysInfo and can neither retrieve or print reports or print lables, your SaClient might be defective and either needs to be reinstalled or just fixed. Backoffice will ask you to reinstall SaClient. If you do this repeatedly and it still does not work, then reinstalling it is not the problem. Instead, you need to run the attached program (FixSaClient.bat) to correct whatever problem SaClient is experiencing. Download the program onto your desktop and run it. You may need to run it as Administrator (right-click on the program and choose Run as administrator).* Click Y to the question asked (only necessary if you run the program as an administrator. Otherwise, it will just run and shut down the below window again within seconds.) It is a good idea to briefly turn off the printer and turn it on again and refresh the browser window. If refreshing the window does not work, briefly log out and log in again in Backoffice. If you are still experiencing problems, please raise a ticket through our Support Portal and we will contact you. ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ *In some cases, this window appears after you have clicked "Run as administrator". Click More Info Click Run anyway In some cases, this information is displayed where the administrator login data must be entered. If you do not know these, ask your IT administrator to enter them.
description:
If you have yellow (or red) exclamation marks in Backoffice on Label, Printout and SysInfo and can neither retrieve or print reports or print lables, your SaClient might be defective and either needs to be reinstalled or just fixed.




Backoffice will ask you to reinstall SaClient. If you do this repeatedly and it still does not work, then reinstalling it is not the problem. Instead, you need to run the attached program (FixSaClient.bat) to correct whatever problem SaClient is experiencing.


Download the program onto your desktop and run it.



You may need to run it as Administrator (right-click on the program and choose Run as administrator).*



Click Y to the question asked (only necessary if you run the program as an administrator. Otherwise, it will just run and shut down the below window again within seconds.)



It is a good idea to briefly turn off the printer and turn it on again and refresh the browser window.



If refreshing the window does not work, briefly log out and log in again in Backoffice.


If you are still experiencing problems, please raise a ticket through our Support Portal and we will contact you.


___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________





*In some cases, this window appears after you have clicked "Run as administrator". Click More Info

 

 

Click Run anyway

 





In some cases, this information is displayed where the administrator login data must be entered. If you do not know these, ask your IT administrator to enter them.

title: Back Office on another computer
text: DdD Back Office is accessible on all Windows computers with Google Chrome browser. 1. Open DdD Back Office in Google Chrome Open Google Chrome and paste the following link into the address bar and confirm with Enter: DdDbackoffice.com 2. Enter your log-in data If you do not know them, you can request them by e-mail. You can find instructions here: I have forgotten my Back Office log in data After you have entered your Client-ID and Client-CODE, you must select a machine. It is important that you select a machine that is not in use on any other PC. If all machines are already in use on other computers, please send a ticket to Support with a request to create a new Back Office machine. Please also let us know what the machine should be called and what the password should be. 3. Install SAClient After you have successfully logged in, you will be asked to install SAClient. You can find instructions for this here: Install SAClient
description:
DdD Back Office is accessible on all Windows computers with Google Chrome browser.


1. Open DdD Back Office in Google Chrome

Open Google Chrome and paste the following link into the address bar and confirm with Enter: DdDbackoffice.com


2. Enter your log-in data

If you do not know them, you can request them by e-mail. You can find instructions here: I have forgotten my Back Office log in data


After you have entered your Client-ID and Client-CODE, you must select a machine. It is important that you select a machine that is not in use on any other PC. If all machines are already in use on other computers, please send a ticket to Support with a request to create a new Back Office machine. Please also let us know what the machine should be called and what the password should be.



3. Install SAClient

After you have successfully logged in, you will be asked to install SAClient. You can find instructions for this here: Install SAClient

title: Missing receipts/notes in Backoffice
text: Are you in doubt about whether all receipts/notes have been transfered to Backoffice (if e.g. there is a difference in Finance Report you can't explain), you can start with ordering a transaction report (either in Backoffice or on the POS). The receipt/note numbers have to be continuous per store with the one exception of the cash balance note (if this is done at the end of day), which is not shown on the list (see the below example, where receipt/note number 48296 is not shown in the report at the end of the day, because it is the cash balance). When you have gone through the report and found missing transactions, you can transfer them yourself if there aren't that many of them. You can only transfer one at a time if you do it yourself. If it is a question of many, then please create a ticket on our portal, citing whic receipte/note numbers are missing (attach the report) and the case will be forwarded to our development team. If it is a matter of a few receipts/notes, open the POS and in the shop assistant field type "export XXXXX" and click the green button as in the example below. The missing receipt/note will now be transfered to Backoffice. The POS will not acknowledge the transfer in any way and you will have to be a little patient, as the transfer speed depends on how busy the system is. After half an hour / an hour you can order a new transaction list to check if the receipts/notes hae turned up.
description:
Are you in doubt about whether all receipts/notes have been transfered to Backoffice (if e.g. there is a difference in Finance Report you can't explain), you can start with ordering a transaction report (either in Backoffice or on the POS).

The receipt/note numbers have to be continuous per store with the one exception of the cash balance note (if this is done at the end of day), which is not shown on the list (see the below example, where receipt/note number 48296 is not shown in the report at the end of the day, because it is the cash balance). 

 

 

When you have gone through the report and found missing transactions, you can transfer them yourself if there aren't that many of them. You can only transfer one at a time if you do it yourself. If it is a question of many, then please create a ticket on our portal, citing whic receipte/note numbers are missing (attach the report) and the case will be forwarded to our development team.

If it is a matter of a few receipts/notes, open the POS and in the shop assistant field type "export XXXXX" and click the green button as in the example below.

 

The missing receipt/note will now be transfered to Backoffice. The POS will not acknowledge the transfer in any way and you will have to be a little patient, as the transfer speed depends on how busy the system is.

 After half an hour / an hour you can order a new transaction list to check if the receipts/notes hae turned up.

title: Exchange rates in DdD Backoffice
text: Exchange rates in Backoffice: You created Exchange rates in Backoffice like this: Exchange rate equals British Pounds (or Danish Kronor. The first line is always fixed to the currency of the shop) compared to e.g. Dollars or Euro. Exchange rate EURO equals if you have 100 Euro and what that is worth in British Pounds. Exsample Exchange rate GDP 100 = EUR 68,91 Kurs EURO Euro 100 = GDP 84,06 The exchange rates are set to today's date. If you want to set an approximate date and stick to that or you want to manually change the exchange rate whenever it changes is up to you Suppliers with Euro prices: Attention!!! You have to create Euro under Currencies before you can use it under Suppliers. If you have a supplier, who uses EURO instead of British Pounds, you can create another version using EURO. Exsample Supplier Lenette (already exists and has been created with British Pounds as Currency. You cannot change the currency on an existing supplier) You then create a new supplier (called e.g. Lenette EURO) with the same information, except for changing the Currency to EURO. If it is a new supplier who only uses EURO, you just create them as a new supplier with EURO as currency.
description:
Exchange rates in Backoffice:

You created Exchange rates in Backoffice like this:


Exchange rate equals British Pounds (or Danish Kronor. The first line is always fixed to the currency of the shop) compared to e.g. Dollars or Euro. 

Exchange rate EURO equals if you have 100 Euro and what that is worth in British Pounds.

Exsample

Exchange rate
GDP 100 = EUR 68,91

Kurs EURO
Euro 100 = GDP 84,06

The exchange rates are set to today's date. If you want to set an approximate date and stick to that or you want to manually change the exchange rate whenever it changes is up to you



Suppliers with Euro prices:

Attention!!! You have to create Euro under Currencies before you can use it under Suppliers.

If you have a supplier, who uses EURO instead of British Pounds, you can create another version using EURO.

Exsample

Supplier Lenette (already exists and has been created with British Pounds as Currency. You cannot change the currency on an existing supplier)

You then create a new supplier (called e.g. Lenette EURO) with the same information, except for changing the Currency to EURO.

 
If it is a new supplier who only uses EURO, you just create them as a new supplier with EURO as currency.

title: Barcode of newly added article replacing old article brings up old article
text: If you have had issues with adding an article and have decided to remove it and add it again, but you cannot delete it because the article has had transactions already (adding items to stock counts as a transaction in Backoffice) you have to remember to remove the EAN code from the old article or this is what the POS will show when the barcode is scanned on the POS. To prevent this, remove the EAN code from the old article. Open the new article, delete the EAN code, save it, add the EAN code again, save it and then run a CHANGEPULL on the POS. That will fix the issue with the POS showing the old article without text etc.
description:
If you have had issues with adding an article and have decided to remove it and add it again, but you cannot delete it because the article has had transactions already (adding items to stock counts as a transaction in Backoffice) you have to remember to remove the EAN code from the old article or this is what the POS will show when the barcode is scanned on the POS.


To prevent this, remove the EAN code from the old article.


Open the new article, delete the EAN code, save it, add the EAN code again, save it and then run a CHANGEPULL on the POS.


That will fix the issue with the POS showing the old article without text etc.
